poem:
**Tunnel of Hostages**

Tracks twisted to the tune of terror—  
Jaffar halted, mid-mountain breath.  
214 souls captive, names whispered  
into the gunmetal night.  
Echoes of Baloch shriek, rail  
and rock confer in shadows.  
A stifled tale rides the wind,  
ghost-whispers through corridors  
of shuddering steel,  
pleading in a language only silence  
knows to hear.
